alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:18PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln and southeastern Payne Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Agra to 4 miles northwest of Carney. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cushing, Chandler, Stroud, Yale, Davenport, Carney, Tryon, Ripley, Agra, Sparks, Warwick, Kendrick, Quay, Avery and Parkland. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 160 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
